name: hcloud
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing hcloud cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`hcloud` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hetznercloud/terraform-provider-hcloud).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing hcloud cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hetznercloud/terraform-provider-hcloud)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-hcloud` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-hcloud/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-hcloud` repo](https://github.com/hetznercloud/terraform-provider-hcloud/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hetznercloud/terraform-provider-hcloud)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-hcloud` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-hcloud/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-hcloud` repo](https://github.com/hetznercloud/terraform-provider-hcloud/issues).

endpoint.description: The Hetzner Cloud API endpoint, can be used to override the default API Endpoint https://api.hetzner.cloud/v1.

pollFunction.description: The type of function to be used during the polling.

pollInterval.description: The interval at which actions are polled by the client. Default `500ms`. Increase this interval if you run into rate limiting errors.

token.description: The Hetzner Cloud API token, can also be specified with the HCLOUD_TOKEN environment variable.

labelSelector.description: Label Selector to select servers the firewall should be applied to (only one of `server` and `label_selector`can be applied in one block)

server.description: ID of the server you want to apply the firewall to (only one of `server` and `label_selector`can be applied in one block)

destinationIps.description: List of IPs or CIDRs that are allowed within this Firewall Rule (when `direction` is `out`)

direction.description: Direction of the Firewall Rule. `in`

port.description: Port of the Firewall Rule. Required when `protocol` is `tcp` or `udp`. You can use `any` to allow all ports for the specific protocol. Port ranges are also possible: `80-85` allows all ports between 80 and 85.

protocol.description: Protocol of the Firewall Rule. `tcp`, `icmp`, `udp`, `gre`, `esp`

sourceIps.description: List of IPs or CIDRs that are allowed within this Firewall Rule (when `direction` is `in`)

type.description: Type of the Load Balancer Algorithm. `round_robin` or `least_connections`

http.description: HTTP configuration. Required if `protocol` is `http`.

interval.description: Interval how often the health check will be performed, in seconds.

port.description: Port the health check tries to connect to, required if protocol is `tcp`. Can be everything between `1` and `65535`. Must be unique per Load Balancer.

protocol.description: Protocol the health check uses. `http` or `tcp`

retries.description: Number of tries a health check will be performed until a target will be listed as `unhealthy`.

timeout.description: Timeout when a health check try will be canceled if there is no response, in seconds.

domain.description: Domain we try to access when performing the Health Check.

path.description: Path we try to access when performing the Health Check.

response.description: Response we expect to be included in the Target response when a Health Check was performed.

statusCodes.description: We expect that the target answers with these status codes. If not the target is marked as `unhealthy`.

certificates.description: List of IDs from certificates which the Load Balancer has.

cookieLifetime.description: Lifetime of the cookie for sticky session (in seconds). Default: `300`

cookieName.description: Name of the cookie for sticky session. Default: `HCLBSTICKY`

redirectHttp.description: Redirect HTTP to HTTPS traffic. Only supported for services with `protocol` `https` using the default HTTP port `80`.

type.description: (string) Type of the Load Balancer Algorithm. `round_robin` or `least_connections`

usePrivateIp.deprecationMessage: Does not work. Use the hcloud.LoadBalancerTarget resource instead.

ip.description: Specify the IP the server should get in the network

macAddress.description: (Optional, string) The MAC address the private interface of the server has

availableServerTypeIds.description: List of currently available Server Types in the Datacenter.

location.description: Location of the Datacenter. See the [Hetzner Docs](https://docs.hetzner.com/cloud/general/locations/#what-locations-are-there) for more details about locations.

supportedServerTypeIds.description: List of supported Server Types in the Datacenter.

labelSelector.description:
(string) Label Selector to select servers the firewall is applied to. Empty if a server is directly
referenced

server.description: (int) ID of a server where the firewall is applied to. `0` if applied to a label_selector

description.description: (Optional, string) Description of the firewall rule

destinationIps.description: (Required, List) List of CIDRs that are allowed within this Firewall Rule (when `direction` is `out`)

direction.description: (Required, string) Direction of the Firewall Rule. `in`, `out`

port.description: (Required, string) Port of the Firewall Rule. Required when `protocol` is `tcp` or `udp`

protocol.description: (Required, string) Protocol of the Firewall Rule. `tcp`, `icmp`, `udp`, `gre`, `esp`

sourceIps.description: (Required, List) List of CIDRs that are allowed within this Firewall Rule (when `direction` is `in`)

selector.deprecationMessage: Please use the with_selector property instead.

type.description: (string) Type of the target. `server` or `label_selector`

destinationPort.description: (int) Port the service connects to the targets on. Can be everything between `1` and `65535`.

healthChecks.description: (list) List of http configurations when `protocol` is `http` or `https`.

https.description: (list) List of http configurations when `protocol` is `http` or `https`.

listenPort.description: (int) Port the service listen on. Can be everything between `1` and `65535`. Must be unique per Load Balancer.

protocol.description: (string) Protocol the health check uses. `http`, `https` or `tcp`

https.description: (list) List of http configurations when `protocol` is `http` or `https`.

interval.description: (int) Interval how often the health check will be performed, in seconds.

port.description: (int) Port the health check tries to connect to. Can be everything between `1` and `65535`.

protocol.description: (string) Protocol the health check uses. `http`, `https` or `tcp`

retries.description: (int) Number of tries a health check will be performed until a target will be listed as `unhealthy`.

timeout.description: (int) Timeout when a health check try will be canceled if there is no response, in seconds.

domain.description: string) Domain we try to access when performing the Health Check.

path.description: (string) Path we try to access when performing the Health Check.

response.description: (string) Response we expect to be included in the Target response when a Health Check was performed.

statusCodes.description: (list[int]) We expect that the target answers with these status codes. If not the target is marked as `unhealthy`.

certificates.description: (list[int]) List of IDs from certificates which the Load Balancer has.

cookieLifetime.description: (int) Lifetime of the cookie for sticky session (in seconds).

cookieName.description: (string) Name of the cookie for sticky session.

redirectHttp.description: (string) Determine if all requests from port 80 should be redirected to port 443.

stickySessions.description: (string) Determine if sticky sessions are enabled or not.

labelSelector.description: (string) Label Selector to add a group of resources based on the label.

serverId.description: (int) ID of the server which should be a target for this Load Balancer.

type.description: (string) Type of the target. `server` or `label_selector`

description.description: Description of the Load Balancer Type.

id.description: ID of the Load Balancer Type.

maxAssignedCertificates.description: Maximum number of certificates that can be assigned for the Load Balancer of this type.

maxConnections.description: Maximum number of simultaneous open connections for the Load Balancer of this type.

maxServices.description: Maximum number of services for the Load Balancer of this type.

maxTargets.description: Maximum number of targets for the Load Balancer of this type.

name.description: Name of the Load Balancer Type.

city.description: Name of the closest city to the Location. City name and optionally state in short form.

country.description: Country the Location resides in. ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code of the country.

latitude.description: Latitude of the city closest to the Location.

longitude.description: Longitude of the city closest to the Location.

networkZone.description: Name of the Network Zone this Location resides in.

exposeRoutesToVswitch.description: Indicates if the routes from this network should be exposed to the vSwitch connection. The exposing only takes effect if a vSwitch connection is active.

aliasIps.description: (list) A list of alias IP addresses assigned to the server in the network.

ip.description: (string) The server's IP address within the network.

macAddress.description: (string) The MAC address associated with the server's private network interface.

networkId.description: (int) The unique identifier for the network.

deprecationAnnounced.description: Date of the Server Type deprecation announcement.

isDeprecated.description: Whether the Server Type is deprecated.

unavailableAfter.description: Date of the Server Type removal. After this date, the Server Type cannot be used anymore.

architecture.description: Architecture of the cpu for a Server of this type.

cores.description: Number of cpu cores for a Server of this type.

cpuType.description: Type of cpu for a Server of this type.

deprecationAnnounced.description: Date of the Server Type deprecation announcement.
deprecationAnnounced.deprecationMessage: The field is deprecated and will gradually be phased out starting 2025-09-24. Use the deprecation in the locations list instead.

disk.description: Disk size in GB for a Server of this type.

includedTraffic.deprecationMessage: The field is deprecated and will always report 0 after 2024-08-05.

isDeprecated.description: Whether the Server Type is deprecated.
isDeprecated.deprecationMessage: The field is deprecated and will gradually be phased out starting 2025-09-24. Use the deprecation in the locations list instead.

locations.description: List of supported Locations for this Server Type.

memory.description: Memory in GB for a Server of this type.

storageType.description: Type of boot drive for a Server of this type.

unavailableAfter.description: Date of the Server Type removal. After this date, the Server Type cannot be used anymore.
unavailableAfter.deprecationMessage: The field is deprecated and will gradually be phased out starting 2025-09-24. Use the deprecation in the locations list instead.

deprecationAnnounced.description: Date of the Server Type deprecation announcement.

isDeprecated.description: Whether the Server Type is deprecated.

unavailableAfter.description: Date of the Server Type removal. After this date, the Server Type cannot be used anymore.

labels.description: User-defined [labels](https://docs.hetzner.cloud/reference/cloud#labels) (key-value pairs) for the resource.

publicKey.description: Public key of the SSH Key pair.

provider.description:
The provider type for the hcloud package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

pollInterval.description: The interval at which actions are polled by the client. Default `500ms`. Increase this interval if you run into rate limiting errors.

token.description: The Hetzner Cloud API token, can also be specified with the HCLOUD_TOKEN environment variable.

targets.deprecationMessage: Use hcloud.LoadBalancerTarget resource instead. This allows the full control over the selected targets.

enablePublicInterface.description: Enable or disable the Load Balancers public interface. Default: `true`

ip.description:
IP to request to be assigned to this Load
Balancer. If you do not provide this then you will be auto assigned an
IP address.

networkId.description: ID of the network which should be added to the Load Balancer. Required if `subnet_id` is not set. Successful creation of the resource depends on the existence of a subnet in the Hetzner Cloud Backend. Using `network_id` will not create an explicit dependency between the Load Balancer and the subnet. Therefore `depends_on` may need to be used. Alternatively the `subnet_id` property can be used, which will create an explicit dependency between `hcloud.LoadBalancerNetwork` and the existence of a subnet.

subnetId.description: ID of the sub-network which should be added to the Load Balancer. Required if `network_id` is not set. _Note_: if the `ip` property is missing, the Load Balancer is currently added to the last created subnet.

enablePublicInterface.description: Enable or disable the Load Balancers public interface. Default: `true`

ip.description:
IP to request to be assigned to this Load
Balancer. If you do not provide this then you will be auto assigned an
IP address.

networkId.description: ID of the network which should be added to the Load Balancer. Required if `subnet_id` is not set. Successful creation of the resource depends on the existence of a subnet in the Hetzner Cloud Backend. Using `network_id` will not create an explicit dependency between the Load Balancer and the subnet. Therefore `depends_on` may need to be used. Alternatively the `subnet_id` property can be used, which will create an explicit dependency between `hcloud.LoadBalancerNetwork` and the existence of a subnet.

subnetId.description: ID of the sub-network which should be added to the Load Balancer. Required if `network_id` is not set. _Note_: if the `ip` property is missing, the Load Balancer is currently added to the last created subnet.

Balancer. If you do not provide this then you will be auto assigned an
IP address.

Successful creation of the resource depends on the existence of a subnet in the Hetzner Cloud Backend. Using `network_id` will not create an explicit dependency between the Load Balancer and the subnet. Therefore `depends_on` may need to be used. Alternatively the `subnet_id` property can be used, which will create an explicit dependency between `hcloud.LoadBalancerNetwork` and the existence of a subnet.

deleteProtection.description: Enable or disable delete protection. See "Delete Protection" in the Provider Docs for details.

exposeRoutesToVswitch.description: Enable or disable exposing the routes to the vSwitch connection. The exposing only takes effect if a vSwitch connection is active.

ipRange.description: IP Range of the whole Network which must span all included subnets and route destinations. Must be one of the private ipv4 ranges of RFC1918.

labels.description: User-defined labels (key-value pairs) should be created with.

name.description: Name of the Network to create (must be unique per project).

deleteProtection.description: Enable or disable delete protection. See "Delete Protection" in the Provider Docs for details.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Network resources.

deleteProtection.description: Enable or disable delete protection. See "Delete Protection" in the Provider Docs for details.

exposeRoutesToVswitch.description: Enable or disable exposing the routes to the vSwitch connection. The exposing only takes effect if a vSwitch connection is active.

ipRange.description: IP Range of the whole Network which must span all included subnets and route destinations. Must be one of the private ipv4 ranges of RFC1918.

labels.description: User-defined labels (key-value pairs) should be created with.

name.description: Name of the Network to create (must be unique per project).

destination.description: Destination network or host of this route. Must be a subnet of the ip_range of the Network. Must not overlap with an existing ip_range in any subnets or with any destinations in other routes or with the first ip of the networks ip_range or with 172.31.1.1.

gateway.description: Gateway for the route. Cannot be the first ip of the networks ip_range and also cannot be 172.31.1.1 as this IP is being used as a gateway for the public network interface of servers.

networkId.description: ID of the Network the route should be added to.

destination.description: Destination network or host of this route. Must be a subnet of the ip_range of the Network. Must not overlap with an existing ip_range in any subnets or with any destinations in other routes or with the first ip of the networks ip_range or with 172.31.1.1.

gateway.description: Gateway for the route. Cannot be the first ip of the networks ip_range and also cannot be 172.31.1.1 as this IP is being used as a gateway for the public network interface of servers.

networkId.description: ID of the Network the route should be added to.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering NetworkRoute resources.

destination.description: Destination network or host of this route. Must be a subnet of the ip_range of the Network. Must not overlap with an existing ip_range in any subnets or with any destinations in other routes or with the first ip of the networks ip_range or with 172.31.1.1.

gateway.description: Gateway for the route. Cannot be the first ip of the networks ip_range and also cannot be 172.31.1.1 as this IP is being used as a gateway for the public network interface of servers.

networkId.description: ID of the Network the route should be added to.

ipRange.description: Range to allocate IPs from. Must be a subnet of the ip_range of the Network and must not overlap with any other subnets or with any destinations in routes.

networkId.description: ID of the Network the subnet should be added to.

type.description: Type of subnet. `server`, `cloud` or `vswitch`

vswitchId.description: ID of the vswitch, Required if type is `vswitch`

ipRange.description: Range to allocate IPs from. Must be a subnet of the ip_range of the Network and must not overlap with any other subnets or with any destinations in routes.

networkId.description: ID of the Network the subnet should be added to.

vswitchId.description: ID of the vswitch, Required if type is `vswitch`

allowDeprecatedImages.description: Enable the use of deprecated images (default: false). **Note** Deprecated images will be removed after three months. Using them is then no longer possible.

backupWindow.description: (string) The backup window of the server, if enabled.
backupWindow.deprecationMessage: You should remove this property from your terraform configuration.

datacenter.description: The datacenter name to create the server in. See the [Hetzner Docs](https://docs.hetzner.com/cloud/general/locations/#what-datacenters-are-there) for more details about datacenters.

deleteProtection.description: Enable or disable delete protection (Needs to be the same as `rebuild_protection`). See "Delete Protection" in the Provider Docs for details.

firewallIds.description: Firewall IDs the server should be attached to on creation.

ignoreRemoteFirewallIds.description: Ignores any updates to the `firewall_ids` argument which were received from the server. This should not be used in normal cases. See the documentation of the `hcloud.FirewallAttachment` resource for a reason to use this argument.

ipv6Address.description: (string) The first IPv6 address of the assigned network.

iso.description: ID or Name of an ISO image to mount.

keepDisk.description: If true, do not upgrade the disk. This allows downgrading the server type later.

labels.description: User-defined labels (key-value pairs) should be created with.

location.description: The location name to create the server in. See the [Hetzner Docs](https://docs.hetzner.com/cloud/general/locations/#what-locations-are-there) for more details about locations.

name.description: Name of the server to create (must be unique per project and a valid hostname as per RFC 1123).

networks.description: Network the server should be attached to on creation. (Can be specified multiple times)

placementGroupId.description: Placement Group ID the server added to on creation.

primaryDiskSize.description: (int) The size of the primary disk in GB.

publicNets.description:
In this block you can either enable / disable ipv4 and ipv6 or link existing primary IPs (checkout the examples).
If this block is not defined, two primary (ipv4 & ipv6) ips getting auto generated.

rebuildProtection.description: Enable or disable rebuild protection (Needs to be the same as `delete_protection`).

rescue.description: Enable and boot in to the specified rescue system. This enables simple installation of custom operating systems. `linux64` or `linux32`

serverType.description: Name of the server type this server should be created with.

shutdownBeforeDeletion.description: Whether to try shutting the server down gracefully before deleting it.

sshKeys.description: SSH key IDs or names which should be injected into the server at creation time. Once the server is created, you can not update the list of SSH Keys. If you do change this, you will be prompted to destroy and recreate the server. You can avoid this by setting lifecycle.ignore_changes to `[ ssh_keys ]`.

userData.description: Cloud-Init user data to use during server creation

aliasIps.description:
Additional IPs to be assigned
to this server.

ip.description:
IP to request to be assigned to this server.
If you do not provide this then you will be auto assigned an IP
address.

networkId.description: ID of the network which should be added to the server. Required if `subnet_id` is not set. Successful creation of the resource depends on the existence of a subnet in the Hetzner Cloud Backend. Using `network_id` will not create an explicit dependency between server and subnet. Therefore `depends_on` may need to be used. Alternatively the `subnet_id` property can be used, which will create an explicit dependency between `hcloud.ServerNetwork` and the existence of a subnet.

serverId.description: ID of the server.

subnetId.description: ID of the sub-network which should be added to the Server. Required if `network_id` is not set. _Note_: if the `ip` property is missing, the Server is currently added to the last created subnet.

aliasIps.description:
Additional IPs to be assigned
to this server.

ip.description:
IP to request to be assigned to this server.
If you do not provide this then you will be auto assigned an IP
address.

networkId.description: ID of the network which should be added to the server. Required if `subnet_id` is not set. Successful creation of the resource depends on the existence of a subnet in the Hetzner Cloud Backend. Using `network_id` will not create an explicit dependency between server and subnet. Therefore `depends_on` may need to be used. Alternatively the `subnet_id` property can be used, which will create an explicit dependency between `hcloud.ServerNetwork` and the existence of a subnet.

serverId.description: ID of the server.

subnetId.description: ID of the sub-network which should be added to the Server. Required if `network_id` is not set. _Note_: if the `ip` property is missing, the Server is currently added to the last created subnet.

Therefore `depends_on` may need to be used. Alternatively the `subnet_id` property can be used, which will create an explicit dependency between `hcloud.ServerNetwork` and the existence of a subnet.

hcloud:index/getDatacenters:getDatacente.description:
Provides a list of available Hetzner Cloud Datacenters.

This resource may be useful to create highly available infrastructure, distributed across several Datacenters.

rapidDeploy.description: (bool) Indicates that rapid deploy of the image is available.

targets.description: (list) List of targets of the Load Balancer.

hcloud:index/getLocations:getLocations.description:
Provides a list of available Hetzner Cloud Locations.

This resource may be useful to create highly available infrastructure, distributed across several locations.
